thread.title: Huawei P10 press render leaked ahead of February 26th unveiling
thread.title_full: Huawei P10 press render leaked ahead of February 26th unveiling

title: Huawei P10 press render leaked ahead of February 26th unveiling
text:
Huawei P10 press render leaked ahead of February 26th unveiling Huawei P10 press render leaked ahead of February 26th unveiling By February 23, 2017 “The Huawei P10 flagship will sport a fingerprint sensor, slim bezels and Leica-branded dual cameras” 
Huawei recently sent out invites for a press event on February 26th at MWC in Barcelona. The brand is expected to unveil the Huawei P10 and P10 Plus flagships at the event. Ahead of the unveiling, we recently posted exclusive press renders and a 360-degree video of the Huawei P10. Now the popular tipster Evan Blass has posted an official-looking render of the Huawei P10. — Evan Blass (@evleaks) February 22, 2017 
The render reveals the Huawei P10 has a similar design as seen in our exclusive renders. The phone appears to sport a metal unibody design and slim bezels. It will offer a physical home button with a fingerprint sensor sitting beneath it. The device will flaunt two rear cameras with a dual-LED flash and Leica branding. 
As per the earlier reports, the Huawei P10 will offer up to 6GB of RAM, up to 128GB of storage, Android Nougat, a Kirin 960 SoC, two 12MP rear cameras, an 8MP selfie shooter and a 3,100mAh battery with fast charging support. The Huawei P10 Plus is expected to come with similar specs except for a larger dual-edge curved screen. Facebook Comments
